ext_descriptions.ext_description: A padstack_arrangement lists the types of the padstack arrangement.
specifies that padstack is arranged from the top;
specifies that padstack is arranged from the bottom;
specifies that padstack is arranged symmetrically;
specifies that padstack is swapable;
A template_arrangement lists the possible values of the template arrangement.
specifies an arrangement to be top;
specifies an arrangement to be bottom;
specifies an arrangement to be symmetrical;
specifies an arrangement to be swapable;

ext_description.p:
There shall be no more than two
referencing any one member of
that are referenced by the stratum_technology_sequence.
ext_description.note: Rules 3, 4, 5 together ensure that the stratum_technology_sequence form a directed list, and that there are no cycles in the sequence and that there are no holes in the sequence.

ext_description.p:
A Physical_unit_keepout_shape_allocation_to_stratum_stack is an allocation of a specific
to a subset of a stackup model.
ext_description.note: The purpose is to allow a generic keepout model in a package library while retaining the ability to associate specific keepout models to specific technologies.
ext_description.example: All layer 1 through 6 Vias may be kept out of a specific point domain of a specific stackup model established by a keepout model of a package using Physical_unit_keepout_shape_allocation_to_stratum_stack. In this example the point domain applies in a design system to the horizontal extent in the appropriate stratum surrounding the placement of the footprint related to the package in the interconnect design.

ext_description.p:
A Template_location_in_structured_template is the relationship that identifies the location of a in a . A Template_location_in_structured_template may be an
or a .
There is exactly one
allowed to reference a Template_location_in_structured_template. There is an optional reference to the parametric data necessary to define the shape of material to be added at the intersection of the assembly occurrence and the trace that intersects that occurrence. A parametric model is provided and not an explicit shape model because the actual angle the trace makes with respect to the assembly occurrence is unknown, and there may be more than one intersection. This model only provides support for one parametric configuration for this data for the Template_location_in_structured_template. In the event that trimming of a shape between the trace and the assembly occurrence is to be exchanged, the use of an instance in the design of is appropriate. If the transform attribute exists, then the parametric data shall not be provided. If the parametric data is provided, the transform shall not be provided.
ext_description.note: The is a geometric shape concept with the result that this requires exactly one shape for the used in a location.

ext_description.p:
A Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model is a type of , , . A Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model is the projected shape of a keepout region around the
in two dimensions.
ext_description.note:
Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape represented by
where the exact relationship between the two shapes is unrecorded.

There may be multiple Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model for a particular purpose. The recommended method to aggregate several Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model that together describe a volumetric constraint is to reference them from a member of .

The sts_vertex_degree_less_than_two function returns TRUE if all Stratum_technology_occurrences referenced by members of input are referenced no more than once as
and no more than once as by members of input. Otherwise it returns false.
